reviews.review: Cidden çok güzel bir oyun. Biz gordon freeman ile half life 1 de o olayları yaşıyorken askerler ne yapıyordu bunu anlatıyor. Biz o askerlerin birinin yerindeyiz.Half life 1 den sahnelerde vardı o detaylar güzeldi.Gordon freeman'i de görüyoruz.
зверь игра

This is a welcome addition for every Half-Life fan. The story follows one of the HECU marines that gets rescued by the Black Mesa staff after his aircraft was shot down. The expansion features many new enemies and additional weaponry. You have the Displacer Cannon, which is like the Half-Life variant of the BFG9000 for one enemy, a M249 machine gun, the Shock Roach, which acts as an alien bazooka and much more.
The level design in this game is great, featuring many puzzles and the maps themselves have less overall bugs and issues than the ones in the original Half-Life.
The main issue I have though is that it's short. It took me roughly 3 hours to finish it, so I recommend getting this on a sale.

[h1]Played with keyboard/mouse[/h1]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Really cheap on a sale (0,99€)
- Improved level design over the original Half-Life
- Some puzzles will make your head spin
- Fast paced action
- Many new enemies and weapons

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
- Short campaign (~3 hours)
- The soundtrack can get a bit repetitive at times

[h1]Mods used:[/h1]
- Improved Gearbox Desert Eagle: http://www.moddb.com/games/half-life-opposing-force/addons/improved-gearbox-desert-eagle

[h1]Overall: 7.5/10[/h1]

[h1]"Government cover ups were not in my job description."[/h1]

Half Life Opposing Force is an amazing expansion to the Half Life series. It follows corporal Adrian Shephard who is assigned to the black mesa facility to eliminate Gordon Freeman. The tutorial of the game is a nice change of pace compared to the previous games and is a nice way to get acclimated with the numerous situations you will encounter in the field. The game has some nice nods to the main Half Life game with brief shots of freeman and visiting familiar locales. The gameplay is identical to the original Half Life but the game also adds a large amount of new weapons to make it stand out from Half Life. There are also quite a few new enemies that really increase the difficulty making it one of the hardest of the series. The game is a decent length compared to Blue Shift but nowhere near as long as Half Life, but it offers plenty of fun throughout it. Overall the game is a great addition for any Half Life fans or even if you are a fan of older shooters.

And finally I beated this game for the first time ever, what can I say about it? So damn good!!! hahaha

I'm going to be honest at first was really lame lol was a hard transition from Half-Life to Opposing Forces, because I started to playing it after I finished Half-Life and it felt so different starting from the first weapon: "The Pipe Wrench" and I was like: Oh man... really? I miss the Crowbar... then the knife it was really attempting to be another game with the same name as the base game I didn't liked that. 

But after progressing into the game and making it through the levels and some where familiar it started to take the shape I wanted from it and started to become the Half-Life game that meant to be. And I started to love it and was that I really loved it it felt like when I played DOOM 3 and DOOM 3: ROE the transition was rough because both are similar but way too different. 

But you get to love it and you not replay the same game, because it has their original levels made for it and some re-used for the game to match the storyline and they did perfectly, bows to Gearbox!

The difficulty was pretty the same as the base game I liked it, well balanced and well made. Kinda short but what you can expect but you'll not get lost with it has a lot of surprises!

And that's all overall it was a great expansion for a great game. I recommend it after you played the base game first you'll not regret it!

Excelente expansión para half-life, luego juego standalone, pone otra pieza más en el universo del juego, en el que interpretas al Marine Adrian, en su viaje para contener la amenaza alienígena y encontrar a Freeman. Nuevos niveles, nuevas armas, nuevo Lore de Half-Life, todo lo necesario para el que jugó el original y quedó queriendo más. Definitely the best of Half-Life expansion packs, but this game is HARD. This game on the easiest difficulty is harder than Half-Life on the hardest difficulty. Be prepared for that. But it's certinaly manageable on the easiest difficulty and worth the play because like most expansion packs from the 90's, this game is SUPER creative with the concept at hand. It introduces creative new weapons (You can use the ceiling-tenticles as kind of a grappling hook!), creative new enemies, and it even introduces a new gameplay mechanic; climbing ropes, and it was handled fairly well too. The level design is also a little different from Half-Life's. You're still in Black Mesa, but the game throws totally new areas your way that you wouldn't expect to see in Half-Life. The new monster designs aren't quite as well done as Half-Life's (a lot more cartoony in Opposing Force), but they're still neat and creative. Definitely worth a try.

1998's truly amazing "Half-Life" was followed by an awesome expansion pack with 1999's "Opposing Force". Returning to the same setting as the original game, "Opposing Force" takes all the things that made "Half-Life" good, mixes them up a little, and adds quite a few new elements. Among the most memorable are the Race X aliens, the displacer cannon, and the barnacle grapple. With its length being approximately half of the original game, and considering the large amount of new content, "Opposing Force" packs quite a punch. I'd even argue that the game is slightly more interesting than "Half-Life" - because I think it doesn't really contain any dull moments (remember "On a Rail" from the original game? :P). Well, anyways, to round off this review: If you enjoyed "Half-Life", go get "Opposing Force". I'm serious. You're gonna love it.

This game is the hardest expansion for Half Life. Not as interesting as the Blue Shift expansion but manages to bring some new things to the table to expand upon the arsenal in the original game.

[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b]
+More Half-Life - we all need more half life games to play (looking at you, HL3)
+More guns - new guns have been added and they are fun to play around with, including the sniper rifle and the grappling hook thing
+more enemies - new types of enemies include muscly mawmen, weird little aliens that shoot darts and quite a few others, spicing up gameplay with different threats
+Music - the music in this game is very fun

[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b]
-Hard - this expansion is harder than the base game and Blue-Shift, expect to be low on health and ammo and die a lot
-buggy - I have experienced a few bugs in this game, but not too much that ruined the experience
-Gimmicky - some features such as getting squads to do things were used more as a plot device then any sort of addition to the gameplay
-Underwhelming final boss - MINOR STRATEGIC SPOILERS: [spoiler]basically do the same thing over and over until it eventually dies, not that difficult to beat, just time consuming with no way of telling how close it is to dying[/spoiler]

[b][u]Overall Score:[/u][/b] 7/10

Neat little expansion pack. The story follows one of the marines who were trying to kill Freeman in Half-Life but apparently all the bloodthirsty ones were in another squad. At various points Shephard, the protagonist in OpForce, temporarily links up with other marines and they frequently quip, "Government cover-ups were not in my job description" and they don't seem too happy about shooting up all the scientists. My favorite part was a funny little alien rocket / grenade (alternate fire) launcher you pick up midway through. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=942191660

[spoiler]I don't know if there was just some glitch for me but the ending might be more horrifying than intended. Unlike with Freeman, G-Man doesn't offer Shephard an employment opportunity and only says he's going to put him somewhere he can do no harm but also no harm will come to him. Then the credits roll, the file says you have been Detained, and the screen goes black. But after the credits finish you can still see the HUD with your health/armor and you can still jump even though it's just a black screen. I only knew I was jumping because he still makes noise when he lands on the ground. Judging from footstep noise you can't move in any other direction either. What a fate. Trapped in a box in pitch darkness forever.[/spoiler]

Первое дополнение к оригинальной Half-Life, показывающее происходящее от лица военных, а если конкретно - капрала Адриана Шепарда, разведчика морской пехоты США, который на вертолётах с своими товарищами отправился по приказу в исследовательский комплекс "Чёрная Меза".
Благодаря этой игре можно увидеть что не все военные, находящиеся в комплексе являются отъявленными мясниками-убийцами, которым нравится убивать ученых. Пройдя под вашим руководительством события Чёрной Мезы, Адриан остановит отряд "Black Ops", который параллельно со морпехами правительство США послало для установки и подрыва ядерных зарядов в надежде на полное уничтожение комплекса вместе с вторгшимися в него пришельцами. По сравнению с другими частями серии - самая разнообразная на оружие, и самая сложная.
Если вы интересуетесь параллельными похождениями Фримена и одного морпеха - этот дополнение расскажет вам увлекательную историю о том, что может сделать один человек для того чтобы вырваться из комплекса, заполненного чудищами.

So after a playtime of 4.8 hours to beat the main campaign on a first run, I'm not totally sure how I feel about this one. Not much longer than blue shift, at least for my amount of playtime, it certainly offered much more in trms of story and variety; at least in a mechanical sense. However, my biggest issue with this particular one is that most of the common enemies, especially nearing the end, turned in to massive bullet sponges who pumped out tons of damage. I suppose this was to further encourage more use of the big power weapons (SAW, alien rocket launcher, etc.) and that would be keeping your squads alive but ammo for these weapons was somewhat limited for the amount of enemies there were and the AI for the squadmates is braindead; they sometimes just don't follow you or they run off to fight the enemieson their own, even if mortally wounded, and get themselves killed while you've taken cover and tried to gt your medic to heal you (who has also run off to get himself killed and won't heal you because he's currently running to fight alienes for the sake of freedom). Weapons like the MP5, Spas-12, Glock, and the Deagle (to some extent) quickly became null against the beefy enemies that you'll be constantly assaulted by. Even the humans enemies took way more damage than they really should have (at least 3 shotgun shells point blank) as compared to in the other two titles of the original half-life "trilogy" (Half-life, Half-life: Blue Shift, and Half-Life: Opposing Force). I can't say it's bad, all my complaints are above, and I still think if you liked the original Half-Life that you should give this and the other spin-off title a go just out of respect for the franchise. If I had to give it a score....I'd say something like...7.5 or 8/10.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is the first expansion episode for Half Life 1. Although about half the length of the original game, it holds up very well as its own story at around 5 hours. The player takes control of one of the soldiers assigned with taking out Gordon. the story takes place parallel to that of the base game.

The game adds new weapons, enemies, and areas, and expands on the story that was introduced in original game. All around, this is a great expansion to a great game and I would recommend it to fans.
c:
es gud

Что такое Half-Life: Opposing Force? Это тот же Half-life, но с новым видением мира, сквозь стёкла противогаза бойца H.E.C.U., с новым геймплейными добавлениями, с хорошим сюжетом, раскрывающим новые части вселенной Half-life. 
Это - эталон качества, как и дополнения, так и игры, в жанре FPS, поэтому, сразу перейдём к плюсам и минусам:

Плюсы:
+ Геймплей одиночной игры. Он вдумчив и многогранен. Никакого тупого мочилова, только напряжённые схватки, и частенько вам придётся напрягать свою голову для решениях головоломок, хотя особого нечего сложного нет. Как уже сказал, схватки напряжённые, очень интересные, будем воевать - где нам только не придётся! - в секретном исследовательском комплексе, в горах, в мире Xen и т.д. Помогать нам в этом будет обширный арсенал из всевозможного оружия, и наши союзники - однополчане, которые имеет свои роли (медик, который может вас вылечить, сварщик, который прорежет автогеном вам дверь для дальнейшего пути и т.д.) и персонал этого несчастного исследовательского центра. А против вас будут и люди, из секретного подразделения Black Ops, и аж две расы пришельцев!
Вообщем, геймплей на твёрдую пятёрку с плюсом, геймплей разнообразный и напряжённый, не дающий заскучать.

+Мультиплеер. Живой и тоже разнообразен, в зависимости от общества и режима сервера, на котором играете. Хотите - будет вам скоротечный, мясной драйвовый дефматч, хотите, будет тактичная, с определением собственных ролей в атаке и обороне, захват флага. Это круто.

+ Сюжет. Завязка такова: солдаты из подразделения Hazardous Environment Combat Unit летят на задание в комплекс Black Mesa, в котором случилось что-то страшное (Каскадный резонанс то бишь), но по пути туда попадают в передрягу - и вертолёт сбивают, и главному герою - 22-ух летнему капралу Шеппарду, очнувшимся без оружия, одному придётся своими силами выбиратся из места ставшему адом...
А дальше сюжет подаётся нам внутренне, через других персонажей, через саму игру - одна из главных особенностей Half-life. Сюжет хорош, интригует, и даёт нам много информации о вселенной Half-life.

+ Атмосфера. Действительно, она есть, немного другая, нежели в Half-life - здесь она более боевая, но ни чуть не хуже. Притом здесь остаётся прекраснейший саундтрек.

+ Технические добавления. Так как OpFor - это Ад-дон, дополнение, то всякие добавки тоже нужно отметить. И отметить тут есть что: кучу нового оружия, новых монстров, новых технических и графических фишек, всё это не даёт соскучиться - однозначно плюс.

+ Большое количество пользовательских модификаций.

Минусы: 
Лично для себя не обнаружил.

Примечания:
• Русского языка нет. (Есть русификаторы)
• Достижения и коллекционные карточки Steam отстутсвуют.
• По скидке игра стоит ~32 рубля.
• Время прохождения варьируется. Вы можете быстро пробежать игру за 4-5 часов, а можете отлично провести часов эдак 12-13. Ну а мультиплеер может отлично вас затянуть. А если и не затянуть, то у вас всегда будет возможность хорошо провести в нём пару матчей.


Итог:
Half-Life: Opposing Force - это детально проработаный аддон, да что там аддон - отдельная игра, повторюсь - эталон качества FPS и дополнений.
Всем рекомендую к употреблению. 10\10.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What is Half-Life: Opposing Force? This is the same Half-life, but with a new vision of the world, through the glass of the gas mask of the fighter H.E.C.U., with new gameplay additions, with a good story, revealing new parts of the Half-life universe.
This - the standard of quality, as well as add-ons, and games in the genre of FPS, so, immediately move on to the pluses and minuses:

Pros:
+ Gameplay of a single player. He is thoughtful and multifaceted. No blunt mochilov, only intense bouts, and often you will have to strain your head for solving puzzles, although there is nothing much complicated. As already said, the fights are intense, very interesting, we will fight - where we just do not have to! - in a secret research complex, in the mountains, in the world of Xen, etc. To help us in this will be a vast arsenal of all kinds of weapons, and our allies are fellow soldiers who have their roles (a medic who can cure you, a welder who will cut through the autogen to you door for further ways, etc.) and the staff of this unfortunate research center. And against you will be people from the secret division of Black Ops, and already two races of aliens!
In general, the gameplay on a solid five with a plus, the gameplay is diverse and tense, not giving boredom.

+ Multiplayer. Live and also varied, depending on the society and the server mode on which you are playing. Do you want - will you be fleeting, meat drive defmatch, want to be tactful, with the definition of their own roles in the attack and defense, capture the flag. That's cool.

+ The plot. The plot is as follows: the soldiers from the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit are flying to the Black Mesa complex, in which something terrible has happened (Cascade resonance, I mean), but on the way they get into trouble and they shoot down the helicopter, and the main character - the 22-year- wit the old corporal Sheppard, waking up without a weapon, one will have to get out of the place with his own strength ...
And then the plot is given to us internally, through other characters, through the game itself - one of the main features of Half-life. The plot is good, intriguing, and gives us a lot of information about the universe of Half-life.

+ Atmosphere. Indeed, it is, slightly different than in Half-life - here it is more militant, but not nearly worse. Moreover, there remains the most beautiful soundtrack.

+ Technical additions. Since OpFor is an Ad-Don, an addition, then all sorts of additives should also be noted. And note there is that: a bunch of new weapons, new monsters, new technical and graphic chips, all this does not let you get bored - definitely a plus.

+ A large number of custom modifications.

Minuses:
I personally did not find it for myself.

Notes:
• There is no Russian language. (There are crackers)
• There are no achievements and collectible Steam cards.
• At a discount, the game costs ~ 32 rubles.
• The travel time varies. You can quickly run the game in 4-5 hours, or you can perfectly spend 12 hours. Well, multiplayer can perfectly tighten you. And if you do not tighten, then you will always have the opportunity to spend a good pair of matches in it.


Outcome:
Half-Life: Opposing Force - this is a detailed addon, but what is the addon - a separate game, I repeat - the standard of quality FPS and add-ons.
I recommend it to everyone. 10 \ 10.

Don't know what to make of this one. On one hand, yeah, you're basically doing everything again, but this time with a green HUD. On the other, this is an extension of an amazing game. So, what's different? Actually a lot.

For one, the tutorial. Actually kind of sets the mood; putting you through boot camp, and full metal jacket boot camp too. And then you actually get into game. You gotta meet officer chunk. The living meme himself, proto-paul blart mall cop. This time he's on your side and he's ready to fight. Of course, after he's done shoving his hand in a vending machine.

Unfortunately, that's where the funhouse ends, and its time to dive face first into what you really came here for: the Black Mesa vent crawling simulator. This one is significantly longer than Blue Shift, and it kind of follows the same structure as the first game, with some welcome deviations, of course. At this point, I feel like I must've explored a million miles of the facility, and that it must be bigger than the entirety of civilization, despite it only having a small lunch area, and one lobby.

If I could point to any game between the three of them as being the weak link, I think it'd be this one. Feels a little less cooked than the others. I don't know. The NPCs are useless, same as before, but the difference is this time instead of just being in your way, they're necessary for progression AND in your way. Woooo! The gun selection is slightly larger this time around, too. You get a few new toys, and a reskin of a toy you already had. (Looking at you, magnum pistol.) 

What else is there. Did I mention NPCs are useless? You actually need their help at crucial points in game. No joking. You need everything to fight the new alien super elite. And they're packing heat too; enough to shred you and your fellows like paper. This game gave me the most trouble out of the three. And that's no small feat considering the difficulty curve on the original Half Life. These new aliens are tough.

The cherry on top is the last area leading up to the ending. It's underwhelming. I didn't even know I was walking in on the final boss before he just appeared to challenge me to a dangerous game of Uno. What he didn't count on was me being smart enough to immedietly beat him in two minutes, completely nullifying his presence as a final boss. I prefered giant floating fetus, honestly.

Would I count this as necessary? Not really. It's a Half Life game, so it's still a million times better than any regular FPS though. I'd consider the time well spent, even if this time around I was a little more disillusioned. The memes were spicy. Two thumbs up.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is an expansion of Half-Life 1. Instead of playing as Gordon Freeman from the normal game, you play as Adrian Shepard, one of the many soldiers invading the Black Mesa base in order to destroy Freeman, and end the alien infestation.

Much like the normal game, this game has no cutscenes, and mostly keeps you in control the whole time. Decisions you make can be based off of what you want to do, not what the game wants you to do. 

A lot of the gun fights in this game are intense as hell, so expect a ton of heavy fire from the enemies in this game. Thankfully, this expansion adds a whole cake load of new weaponry that wasn't in the normal game. There are so many weapon choices, you can get overwhelmed sometimes at how much scrolling you'd have to do mid-combat. That's only a minor issue. All of the weapons play beautifully, and are pretty dang creative. 

With new weapons also comes new enemies, and this game throws quite a bit of new enemies into the game. You'll only see the enemies from the normal game near the beginning, but later, the newer enemies make more prominent appearances. 

This game's tutorial stage is also something really cool. Even if you know how to play an FPS, you should still check out the tutorial. It makes the game's story feel a little more fleshed out.

The few nitpicks I have are the aforementioned over saturation of weapons you get, and I also think that some of the chapters in this game just feel like a repeat of a normal Half-Life chapter, just with different complications and locations. Also, platforming is still an issue, but it shows up much less often than it did in normal-life. 

Overall: 8.5/10
One of the best expansions, and a good example for making a good expansion pack. This doesn't dissapoint. 

I recommend you play normal Half-Life first. It enhances the flavor of this game.
